repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: currently if using period trigger completion pointer variable can not continue completion and abbr format is broken.

Solution: if word not match using filterText as word and accept textEdit

Now 
![test](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4fffea55-b027-4db2-aefd-2bcce264baf3)


After
![test1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56e60c04-8ce5-4f72-9d61-ffd4e0109298)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
```

This looks unrelated?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body: if keep there , continuing input will clean pum `wp.` then input w. pum is cleaned
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body:
But isn't removing it breaking the functionality to fetch more results if the initial results were incomplete?
Is there some state hiccup that causes isIncomplete to have the wrong value?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body: clangd returns isInComplete true but subsequent input clangd returns empty results. a bit strange ðŸ¤”
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body: Maybe worth reporting upstream with clangd? In the meantime we could instead guard the `vim.fn.complete(start_col, matches)` and call it only if there are matches given that we rely on the pum mechanism to do the filtering we don't need a response to "wipe out" any shown candidates.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_regular_data.body: i haven't look at  #30905  but i will check it later. now the fu can expand correctly

> now the fu can expand correctly

Works for me too, thanks
